Authors:
Pei Tian, Wenbo Xu, Chunjie Li, Hui Song, Meining Wang,
Zhibiao Nan
Title:
Confirmation and taxonomy of one hybrid Epichloë species
symbiotic with Festuca sinensis in northwest of China
Keywords:
Epichloë endophytes; Festuca sinensis; morphology;
phylogenetic relationships; hybrid species
Abstract:
Forty-three unique taxa in Epichloë endophytes symbiotic
with grasses, including distinct species, subspecies and varieties have
been described based on morphology, host specificity and phylogenetic
analyses. In this study, one new Epichloë endophytes, Epichloë sinensis
isolated from Festuca sinensis was collected from northwest of China.
The morphological results indicated that this endophyte had typical
morphological characteristics in Epichloë genus. Phylogenetic
relationships based on introns sequences of the housekeeping genes
β-tubulin (tubB) showed that this endophyte was asexual interspecific
hybrid from E. typhina complex (ETC) and E.sibirica in subclade I-tub.
Morphology and phylogenetic evidence supported the designation of
isolates from F. sinensis as a new interspecific hybrid species.
